column5: Hey all! Our group is going to Minnitaki on 6/13, staying at Donnelly's for the 5th year. Anyone know about water levels? Are they low? Can we get through the short cut? How has the fishing been? Any reports would help. We are ready to go NOW! Thanks for any help. Sportfisher
If the Rags is the shortcut to which you refer, there was a post about 10 days ago on a low water thread that said the Rags was open.

Thanks but I wasn't talking about the Rags. The shortcut I meant was the shortcut from the arm down to the main lake. It is just a short ways down the lake from Donnelly's. In high water years it is dicey to get through. Just wondered what it was like this year. Sportfisher
You talking about the chutes from minnitaki into abram.if you are its all good

If you mean the southwest channel behind Burnt Island, everything should be good. Lake levels on MAPB lakes are above average right now, not record high or even close but high enough. But I guess you could inquire at Donnellys if you want the most up to date info.
RedRyder: Thanks. I sent Donnelly's an email on Saturday, but haven't heard back yet. And yes, that is the one, behind Burnt Island.
